data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you go 2 steps backward (from facing forward), you are going to land on your feet. Taking 2 steps backward (from facing forward) is part of the initial direction of travel. When you make a forward motion in a direction of one opposite direction, your path ends in the opposite direction. You take 3 steps backward (from facing forward) is part of the initial direction of travel. In order to take 8 steps forward, you need to make 8 steps towards future towards starting point.
